alert.note: Alert for Far Northwest Highlands; Jemez Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 12 at 4:43PM MST until December 12 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow continuing. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 5 inches. Higher totals between 7 and 9 inches possible across the peaks and higher west facing slopes. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph will create areas of blowing snow and reduced visibility. * WHERE...Far Northwest Highlands, Jemez Mountains, and Tusas Mountains Including Chama. * WHEN...Until 11 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com. Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.

area.areaDesc: Far Northwest Highlands; Jemez Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama
